name: Courtyard by Marriott Toronto Downtown

reviews.text: Having stayed at other Courtyards, I expected basic, but clean and well organized, accommodations. In fact, this hotel seems like a full blown Marriott at Courtyard prices. The lobby was inviting, expansive, and classical music played softly in the background. The staff was courteous, efficient, and helpful. Our room, although at the lowest rate, had a nice view and was impeccably clean. It was a pleasure to return to every day. We had a few quibbles: the bathroom was a little tight and Internet service was a little sluggish. However, we left the hotel very impressed and ready to return.
reviews.title: Excellent
Great Hotel, location not Ideal for young children!
reviews.text: I stayed here between June 23rd to June 30th 2005 with my wife and 3 year old daughter. We got a fantastic price due to a special Long Term Stay rate through Travelocity. The Hotel was 1st class in every sense! Front Desk staff were as good as I've come across, the room was excellent and very spacious. Our daughter is fussy when it comes to eating out therefore I requested a Microwave and Mini-Fridge from reception and within 10 minutes of my request they were delivered to our door at no extra charge - that's what I call service!! It was one of the best hotels we have stayed at, very clean, modern with excellent staff and facilities.

The only negative is the location!! It is situated on the less-refined part of Yonge Street with a large number of beggars to be found and too many Adult orientated shops for our liking which brings the area down a bit. The bottom end of Yonge Street or Harbourfront looked a bit more appealing.
reviews.title: Perfect spot in the city!
A real winner!
reviews.text: Ideal for a Short Stay in Toronto & definately reccomended!

reviews.title: Not Impressed
reviews.text: We were in town for a convention June 30 thru July 4. Purchased a $7 transit pass for 4 days (through our convention)......which was perfect! This hotel is 1/4 block from the "College" station of the TTC Subway. Very easy to get to the convention center via Union Station subway stop.
Used this hotel for our summer holiday. Rooms are of a good size & were ideal for a family of 4. Rooms are clean & comfortable with daily room service.
reviews.title: Good quality hotel

reviews.text: Staff are friendly & helpful. The information desk is particularly helpful when booking trips. Good location on Yonge Street near a subway station & within easy walking distance to the Eaton Centre or Bloor Street. The restaurant is good for all meals & is competitive. A Golden Griddle & Frans are close if you want to have breakfast out. The gym is well equipped & the pool is small but fine if not too busy.
reviews.title: Convenient location
Loved the Marriott
reviews.text: There is a small baby pool. The hotel has a self-service laundry, which is very useful if staying for more than a few nights.
Very pleased with this hotel & when we are back in Toronto would stay here.
reviews.title: Beds really comfy

reviews.text: We spent two nights at the Courtyard Marriott, choosing it both for its relative low price and its great location. The hotel is one short block north of a subway line, but in reasonable weather, it's not at all unpleasant to walk from downtown or from the University of Toronto campus. Closer still is the Church and Wellesley village area. Finding restaurants, therefore, is quite easy as is getting to good shopping or movies.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: There is nothing about his hotel that will knock your socks off but it's clean, relatively new and in a very convenient location if you're gay. It's right behind Church St. which is where all the gay bars and restaurants are. This place is also close to a lot of the other things Toronto is known for. I can't imagine anyone having many complaints about this place.
reviews.title: Gay? Stay here!

reviews.text: My three friends and I stayed at this hotel for three nights in mid-August and were pretty satisfied with our experience. We had a two double-bed room, which was large enough to accomodate all of us (and our luggage). The bathroom was small, and the sink was located outside of it, which actually helped in our case since we were four girls sharing one bathroom. We did have to call housekeeping once or twice in order to deliver more towels to our rooms; there should have been four sets of towels since the room could hold a maximum of four people, so I thought that that was odd. Service was very helpful, and the free internet in the lobby came in handy.
reviews.title: Would stay here again

reviews.text: We stayed at the same time as the reviewers from 8/22 and 8/23 did, so we experienced the blackout as well. Luckily, we had just arrived from a night out, had finished showering, and had not yet fallen asleep when the announcements were made about the blackout around 2am. We were grateful that the staff had kept us informed, but we could see how this would have literally been a rude awakening for others. The power wasn't restored until sometime between 10am and 5pm the next day.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: The location was good, as described by other reviewers. We walked, took the subway or taxi, and drove to various places. There were lots of eateries around. The one problem that my friends ran into was trying to find an ATM that would accept their Visa bank cards, and they could only use RBC, which was luckily located across the street. Apparently, Visa isn't everywhere you want to be since Toronto heavily supports Mastercard.

reviews.text: Great, for a chain hotel. Not the lap of luxury, but no slouch either. We'd stay here again. We got a last-minute package deal on site59: 3 nights, round trip non-stop arifare, incl. taxes and fees, for ~$400.

reviews.text: The room was clean, bed was comfy. Reliable service. TV good. Sink outside W.C. Tourism representative was helpful and friendly. (The room's comfy chair did smell of BO from a previous guest, but you can't blame the hotel for that! We shoved it in the closet.) We didn't eat at their facilities, so no review.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel- Toronto ain't what it used to be

reviews.text: Great location!! Not "sleazy", just "city". You can get ANYWHERE in the city from here. Yonge in this area is a quixotic mix of mid- and high-end clothing stores, health food places, excellent mid-priced restaurants, X-rated businesses, record stores, haridressers, gay bars, Starbucks and housewares stores. If the 3 or 4 X-rated stores and "Condomania" make people think "sleazy", then you can't see the forest for the trees.

aka: Courtyard By Marriott Toronto Downtown Hotel
description: The Courtyard Downtown Toronto, located in the heart of downtown Toronto, at the corner of Yonge & College Sts., minutes from fashionable shopping, restaurants, museums, galleries, theatre, financial, government and discovery districts. Steps from College subway station, 25 min. from Pearson International Airport. Complimentary high speed wireless intenet access in every guest room!
